title: Employment; size of company, SIC2008
maintainer_displayname: ZBO | Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek
name: employment-size-of-company-sic2008
notes:
This table comprises yearly figures on the main aspects of employment, wages and working hours in the Netherlands. The information in this table is broken down by sex of the employee, type of employment contract, size of enterprise and classification according to Standard Industrial Classification of all Economic Activities (SIC 2008)

Data available from: 2009.

Status of the figures:
These Figures are definite. 

Changes as of 20 February 2015:
The new figures for 2013 are added.

Changes as of 31 March 2014:
The figures for 2009-2011 are revised because of a change in how company size is derived. In the past the company size was derived entirely on the basis of the number of jobs per company unit. This was based on data of the Policy Record Administration. Now company size is derived mainly by linking company units with units in the Industrial Classification of all Economic Activities (SIC). Company size in SIC is derived on the basis of the number of fulltime equivalents (FTE’s) rather than on the number of jobs. As a result, the company size has changed in about half the jobs between 2009 and 2011. 
There has been a correction of 7 thousand jobs on the total level of revision year 2010 (after change of methods).  Double records were accidently used when previous outcomes of Statline were compiled. 

For the years under review 2009 and 2010 (before the change of method) category ‘B’ lacked in the construction of A-F (industry sector/branch). From now on ‘B’ is included in the outcomes.
In the figures from 2010 onwards (after the change of method), Statistics Netherlands made a change for the number of jobs and the labour volume with ‘0’ as their value. The figures of  ‘payment per job’ and ‘working hours’ were also set to ‘0’. These cells included too little data. In the past these cells had been filled. 

When will new figures be published?
New figures for 2014 will be published in the fourth quarter of 2015.
